intro: Waltheria regnellii, commonly known as the Florida morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically blue or violet in color, blooming in the early morning. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Waltheria regnellii thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
